result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward H Mckay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Edward H Mckay is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Edward H Mckay was found guilty of Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Edward H Mckay was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and victim witness surcharges.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program only after serving the first six (6) months of sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment; if in school full time, obtain/maintain part time employment.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug houses and/or drug dealers.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward H Mckay

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (54 pages) CHANGE OF PLEA/SENTENCING commencing MAY 27, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Edward H Mckay in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Edward H Mckay in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED/READ-IN; COUNT 3 DISMISSED and COUNT 5 DISMISSED.  

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to COUNTS 1 and 4  and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty on COUNTS 1 and 4 as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 30 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence. 
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program only after serving the first six months of sentence and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause;
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Random urine screens 
-No association with drug houses and/or drug dealers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Obtain/maintain full time employment; if in school full time, obtain/maintain part time employment
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program

AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Corrections, concurrent with COUNT 1 and consecutive to any other sentence.  
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision in COUNT 1; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court ordered suspension of defendant's driving privileges for a period of 24 months, consecutive. 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Edward H Mckay not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for plea and sentencing hearing however, the defendant was not produced. A new plea and sentencing date was selected. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Edward H Mckay not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant was not produced for todays proceedings.  Adjourned dates selected with the parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Edward H Mckay not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Case set for 

Plea/sentencing hearing on 4-29-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 21.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Edward H Mckay not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Scheduling conference.  ADA Carmody unable to discuss matter with defense due to being on the record for an extended length of time.  Case set for status.

  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward H Mckay in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Edward H Mckay in custody.  Ron Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Rudolfo Alverado-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Edward H Mckay in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  
Defendant Edward H Mckay in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defense enters a plea of Not Guilty as to all Misdemeanor Counts. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
